repo.name: boto3

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and installation instructions with solid quick-start guidance, though it could benefit from more diverse real-world usage examples beyond the basic S3 bucket listing.
readme.top_issue: Limited examples - only shows basic S3 bucket listing; lacks examples for other common services like EC2, Lambda, or different S3 operations (upload/download files)

common_complaints: Documentation gaps and inaccuracies (DynamoDB conditions, S3 endpoint behavior, API parameters)
Numeric precision handling in DynamoDB (big numbers, scientific notation)
Dependency issues causing build failures (awscrt GIL incompatibility)
API response field discrepancies (CloudWatchLogs missing fields)
Credential precedence and environment variable handling
praise_themes: Issues marked as 'contribution-ready' showing some community engagement pathway
Mix of bug reports and feature requests indicates active usage
sentiment.summary: boto3 shows moderate community health with responsive maintainers addressing issues, but suffers from persistent documentation quality problems, unresolved numeric precision edge cases, and upstream dependency compatibility challenges that frustrate users.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite being a major AWS SDK
No closed issues in past 6 months indicating lack of maintenance activity
No merged PRs in past 6 months suggesting no active development
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
Last commit timestamp is suspicious (2026-01-10 is a future date, likely data quality issue)
positive_signals: Package still has an open issue backlog (174 issues)
maintenance.summary: boto3 appears abandoned or severely neglected with no maintenance activity, commits, or contributor engagement in the past 6 months, raising significant concerns for a critical AWS SDK package.
